Born on June 28, 1971, in Pretoria, South Africa, Elon Musk is an entrepreneur and business magnate who's made quite a name for himself through his ventures in various technological and innovative fields. Known for his relentless drive and ambitious goals, Musk has not only shaped but is set to redefine our future.

Musk moved to the United States at the age of 17 to attend Queen's University in Canada but transferred to the University of Pennsylvania, where he studied physics and economics. He later earned his PhD in energy physics from the University of Cambridge, specializing in the field of high-temperature superconductivity.

Musk started his entrepreneurial journey with Zip2, a business-to-business online information service, in 1996, which was bought by Compaq for $307 million in 1999. Using the capital from the sale of Zip2, he co-founded X.com, an online payment company, in 1999. X.com merged with Confinity, a leading PDA manufacturer, and evolved into PayPal, which was later sold to eBay for $1.5 billion in 2002.

In 2002, Musk founded X.com, which later became SpaceX, an aerospace manufacturer and space transport services company, aiming to reduce the costs of space travel and make life multi-planetary. With his vision of colonizing Mars, SpaceX has launched numerous successful missions and developed the Falcon 9, the first privately funded liquid-fueled rocket to reach orbit and the first to successfully land an orbital rocket booster.

In 2004, Musk launched Tesla, Inc., an electric vehicle and clean energy company, with the goal of accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. The company's innovative electric cars, solar energy products, and energy storage solutions have not only redefined the automotive industry but have also played a significant role in driving the global renewable energy transition.
